channel.title: Home Barista
channel.description: The house of Home Barista - Provides news, brewing guides, and stories about coffee.

item.title: What Is Cortado?
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description:
There are so many opinions on what Cortado is. Whether you are ordering a Cortado or offering it to your customers, there is much room for discussion. Nevertheless, it is still the main item on the coffee menu, but due to various factors, it may not exist for long.

What Is Cortado? Read More >>

item.title: Brew Coffee At Home: 11 Brewing Methods Compared
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Are you looking for a new appliance to make coffee? There are many utensils to choose from, and the coffee brewed by each utensil also tastes different. Let's not mention the difficulty of operation here.

Brew Coffee At Home: 11 Brewing Methods Compared Read More >>

item.title: Train Your Coffee Palate
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
For baristas, you have to go through the cupping test to get the beans you want. For consumers, it is not necessary to know cupping. As long as you know how to measure, you will feel different when you drink coffee.

Train Your Coffee Palate Read More >>

item.title: Turkish Coffee: Not only Coffee But Life
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
In fact, Turkish coffee has been around for a long time. Let's introduce Turkish coffee well!

Turkish Coffee: Not only Coffee But Life Read More >>

item.title: What Is Decaffeinated Coffee?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
For some sensitive people, just a little bit of caffeine is enough to have a negative effect. This is where decaffeinated coffee is a good choice for such sensitive people or for those who have deliberately given up caffeine.

What Is Decaffeinated Coffee? Read More >>

item.title: Trading Patterns Of Green Coffee Beans
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
What is the trading model for green coffee beans? Whether you are a producer, a roaster, or a consumer, you can make a more informed choice if you know more about how it is bought and sold.

Trading Patterns Of Green Coffee Beans Read More >>

item.title: How To Use A French Press?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
If you already have a beloved French press in your cupboard, get it out, wash it and follow these simple steps to make a brand new cup of coffee!

How To Use A French Press? Read More >>

item.title: Understand The Three Stages Of The Espresso Extraction
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The extraction process of the espresso is not simple, even if the extraction time is very short. There are many chemical and physical changes taking place in the coffee ground when you extract it.

Understand The Three Stages Of The Espresso Extraction Read More >>

item.title: Physical Changes During Coffee Roasting
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Roasting can transform coffee beans from green beans into mature beans with rich aroma and flavor, but do you know what happens in the roasting process? It is mainly divided into physical and chemical changes. Let's first look at the physical changes of coffee beans during roasting.

Physical Changes During Coffee Roasting Read More >>

item.title: Why Does Coffee Need Degassing? It's Better To Drink After Degassing
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Many beginners of coffee have heard that degassing needs to be stored in one-way exhaust valve bags or one-way exhaust valve cans. Indeed, these steps will make the flavor of coffee beans better.

Why Does Coffee Need Degassing? It's Better To Drink After Degassing Read More >>

item.title: How Can I Adjust The Acidity Of Coffee By Brewing?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
A bright, lively, and rich acidity, which may remind you of a fruity, sweet orange flavour, is quite acceptable to coffee lovers. Whether you want to emphasize the natural, juice-like acidity of the coffee, or avoid the unpleasant stinky acidity of the coffee, this is what you can do.

How Can I Adjust The Acidity Of Coffee By Brewing? Read More >>

item.title: What You Should Know About Ek43?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
EK was originally designed as a grinding machine for pour over coffee, and its advantages outweigh the inherent disadvantage of not being able to stably provide coffee ground (for example, put 20g of coffee beans with an error of 1-1.5g).

What You Should Know About Ek43? Read More >>

item.title: How Do Emphasize The Coffee Body Through Brewing And Roasting?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Why are some coffee stronger than others? What is a body? The body also appears on the cup gauge. But do we really know what a body is? Why are some coffees so tall? How can we emphasize the quality of the body through roasting or boiling?

How Do Emphasize The Coffee Body Through Brewing And Roasting? Read More >>

item.title: Guidelines And Development of French Press
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
If you like coffee, you may have heard of the French press. This brewing appliance may have many different names and patents from different regions, but what are the origin and historical development of this appliance? And how to make coffee?

Guidelines And Development of French Press Read More >>

item.title: How Do I Make Cold Brewed Coffee With Aeropress In Two Minutes?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
As one of the representative appliances of high-quality coffee, the aeropress is not only widely used, but also very convenient to use. It is not easy to use it to make a cup of bad coffee, and it is also easy to use to experiment and create exclusive brewing formulas.

How Do I Make Cold Brewed Coffee With Aeropress In Two Minutes? Read More >>

item.title: How Does The Coffee Grinding Temperature Affect Coffee Quality?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The relationship between the temperature of coffee powder and coffee quality is often ignored. Coffee powder temperature is indeed related to coffee quality, and the coffee industry is gradually paying attention to this problem.

How Does The Coffee Grinding Temperature Affect Coffee Quality? Read More >>

item.title: How To Choose The Home Coffee Grinder?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The best way to use coffee is to grind it as you go or to grind it in small quantities and use it quickly.

How To Choose The Home Coffee Grinder? Read More >>

item.title: Will Rainfall During The Harvest Destroy The Coffee Quality?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
In El Salvador, for example, the annual coffee harvest takes place from November to March. This is a cold and dry season, ideal for picking the coffee fruit. However, all this will vary depending on the rainfall.

Will Rainfall During The Harvest Destroy The Coffee Quality? Read More >>

item.title: How Does Pulse Pouring Affect Coffee Extraction?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
If you want to make good coffee, you can't ignore the importance of water quality. Water temperature, water quality, chemical composition, pouring method, etc. will affect the flavor, aroma, and extraction rate of coffee extraction.

How Does Pulse Pouring Affect Coffee Extraction? Read More >>

item.title: What Exactly Are Fair Trade And Direct Trade?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Whether you're a professional or a simple coffee lover, these terms come up in almost all coffee circles. But what is the real difference between these two trading models?

What Exactly Are Fair Trade And Direct Trade? Read More >>

item.title: 4 Rules For Fresh Coffee
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
There is no perfect measure to ensure that you can get excellent quality coffee every time you buy coffee beans. But there are several important points to keep in mind: when to roast? Which store to buy? How to save the beans bought at home? This will increase the probability of enjoying good coffee every time.

4 Rules For Fresh Coffee Read More >>

item.title: How Does Fermentation Affect Coffee Flavor?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
To put it simply, fermentation is the process of sugar and starch decomposing into acid or alcohol. Let's have a deeper discussion.

How Does Fermentation Affect Coffee Flavor? Read More >>

item.title: The Difference Between On-Farm Processing And Central Processing
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
For coffee producers, it is a major choice to choose centralized processing of raw beans or direct processing on the farm, which will affect the income of producers, coffee production, quality, the workload of workers, etc. But what is the difference between the two processing methods?

The Difference Between On-Farm Processing And Central Processing Read More >>

item.title: Something About Coffee Plants
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
What does a coffee tree really look like? What species are there? And how do the differences between the flowers and the fruit of the coffee tree affect the cup of coffee we drink every day?

Something About Coffee Plants Read More >>

item.title: How Does Coffee Ground Temperature Cause Coffee Quality Unstable?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Are you concerned about the change in water temperature of 3 degrees Celsius in the coffee machine? If so, you should also pay attention to the temperature changes of the coffee powder. The relationship between temperature and coffee quality of coffee powder tends to be overlooked.

How Does Coffee Ground Temperature Cause Coffee Quality Unstable? Read More >>

item.title: Something About Coffee Beans Trading

item.description:
What is the trading pattern of coffee beans? Whether you're a producer, a bean dryer, or a consumer, you can make a smarter choice if you know how it sells.

item.title: How To Brew Coffee While Traveling?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
How to drink good coffee when traveling? There may be supermarkets or coffee shops everywhere in the city, but it's a bit troublesome to worry about stepping on landmines and wanting to brew coffee yourself, and most people don't bring another bunch of appliances for coffee.

item.description:

item.title: How To Brew Delicious Cold Brew Coffee With Aeropress?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The Aeropress is well known for its simple operation, which does not require concentric circles or multiple water injections but simply adding coffee and water, stirring, and pressing. The form of making a cold brew with the Aeropress is similar, but you still have a lot of room to discover the best recipe for your brew.

How To Brew Delicious Cold Brew Coffee With Aeropress? Read More >>

item.title: Some Factors Make Coffee Bad

item.description:

item.title: The Ideal Water Quality For The Perfect Coffee
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Early in the morning, look slowly into the pot of dripping coffee, and count the cup of coffee in front of you into daily drinking water, after all, a cup of coffee is nearly 98% water. At the same time, this means that boiled water has a great impact on the flavor and quality of coffee. If you are eager to rinse out delicious coffee, use the right water.

The Ideal Water Quality For The Perfect Coffee Read More >>

item.title: Several Factors Affecting Coffee Flavor
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:

item.title: How To Choose Coffee Bag
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Don't ignore the importance of coffee bags for coffee preservation. The packaging you choose affects the freshness of coffee beans, the efficiency of preservation, the length of coffee beans preservation, etc.

item.title: Something About Coffee Honey Processing
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Coffee lovers know that there are natural processing and washing, but what is honey processing that has emerged in recent years?

Something About Coffee Honey Processing Read More >>

item.title: Something About Coffee Extraction
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Extraction plays the most important role in brewing a cup of coffee. No matter whether it is pour-over, espresso concentrated, or any brewing method, it has a considerable relationship with extraction. Extraction is the key point of brewing a cup of coffee, and it is divided into several aspects.

Something About Coffee Extraction Read More >>

item.title: Understanding Coffee Starts With A Coffee Bean
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Many people think coffee is just a black powder in a jar, but they forget that coffee is actually a seasonal and cyclical fruit that grows on a tree. It needs to go through a series of complex artificial polishing, in order to turn into a cup of warm drink that emits a rich flavor. The perfect transformation of a cup of coffee, or from the coffee beans, and now talk to you about the coffee beans of those things.

Understanding Coffee Starts With A Coffee Bean Read More >>

item.title: Is It Important To Know About Coffee Producing Regions?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Coffee producing countries are very busy during harvest time with the harvesting and processing of the fruit, and then we buy the raw coffee beans to roast, brew and drink. The laborers in the production area move seasonally to the production area to be harvested and quickly load the ripe fruit onto trucks to be transported to the processing yards near the farms.

Is It Important To Know About Coffee Producing Regions? Read More >>

item.title: Something About The History Of Drip Coffee
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Do you know something about the evolve of pour over coffee? Why is this simple brewing method the favorite of the speciality coffee trend? This article takes you on a journey through the history of drip coffee.

Something About The History Of Drip Coffee Read More >>

item.title: How To Store Coffee Beans: A Comprehensive Guide
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
As a coffee enthusiast, you know how important it is to store your coffee beans properly. Coffee beans are delicate, and improper storage can quickly ruin the flavor and aroma of your beans. Whether you're a home barista or a professional coffee roaster, proper storage is key to maintaining the quality of your coffee beans. In this comprehensive guide, we'll cover everything you need to know about storing coffee beans to keep them fresh and flavorful.

How To Store Coffee Beans: A Comprehensive Guide Read More >>

item.title: The Significance Of Knowing Where Your Coffee Comes From
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
In the vast and interconnected world of coffee, each cup holds a story. It's a story that begins at the origin - the place where coffee is grown, harvested, and processed. The origin of your coffee plays a vital role in shaping its quality, sustainability, ethical considerations, and overall impact. In this article, we will explore why it is crucial to know where your coffee comes from, delving into the factors that contribute to a truly exceptional coffee experience.

The Significance Of Knowing Where Your Coffee Comes From Read More >>

item.title: Adjusting Coffee Acidity: A Guide To Enhancing Or Reducing Acidity In Your Brew
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Coffee acidity is a fundamental element that contributes to the complex flavors and vibrant characteristics of our favorite beverage. Whether you prefer a bright and lively cup or a mellow and smooth brew, understanding how to adjust coffee acidity allows you to tailor your coffee experience to your personal taste preferences. In this article, we delve into the art and science of manipulating coffee acidity, exploring techniques to increase or decrease acidity and unlock new dimensions of flavor in your cup.

Adjusting Coffee Acidity: A Guide To Enhancing Or Reducing Acidity In Your Brew Read More >>

item.title: French Press Coffee: Exploring The Optimal Grind Size
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The French press brewing method is beloved by coffee enthusiasts for its simplicity and ability to extract robust flavors from coffee beans. To achieve the best results with a French press, one crucial factor to consider is the grind size of the coffee. The grind size plays a significant role in the extraction process, affecting the flavor, aroma, and overall quality of the brewed coffee.

French Press Coffee: Exploring The Optimal Grind Size Read More >>
